publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3499 Aileen Campbell: Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight—That the Parliament celebrates the launch of Fairtrade Fortnight 2009, which runs from 23 February to 8 March 2009; encourages the people of Scotland to support and take part in Fairtrade Fortnight, whether by simply choosing to buy fairtrade goods or through holding their own fairtrade events; acknowledges the need to raise awareness and make a positive impact on the unfair trade rules that keep two billion people, a third of humanity, in poverty, and commends the invaluable work undertaken by the Fairtrade Foundation to improve the trading position of producer organisations around the world and deliver sustainable livelihoods for farmers, workers and their communities.

S3M-3499 Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 23 February 2009) Nanette Milne*, Ian McKee*, Christina McKelvie*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Rob Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Brian Adam*, Liam McArthur*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Robert Brown*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-3499 Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 23 February 2009) Angela Constance*, Ken Macintosh*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3499 Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 23 February 2009) Maureen Watt*, Jackie Baillie*

S3M-3499 Aileen Campbell: Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight—That the Parliament celebrates the launch of Fairtrade Fortnight 2009, which runs from 23 February to 8 March 2009; encourages the people of Scotland to support and take part in Fairtrade Fortnight, whether by simply choosing to buy fairtrade goods or through holding their own fairtrade events; acknowledges the need to raise awareness and make a positive impact on the unfair trade rules that keep two billion people, a third of humanity, in poverty, and commends the invaluable work undertaken by the Fairtrade Foundation to improve the trading position of producer organisations around the world and deliver sustainable livelihoods for farmers, workers and their communities. Supported by: Nanette Milne, Ian McKee, Christina McKelvie, Joe FitzPatrick, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Rob Gibson, Alasdair Allan, Patricia Ferguson, Jamie Hepburn, Brian Adam, Liam McArthur, Kenneth Gibson, Bob Doris, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Hugh O’Donnell, Robert Brown, Gil Paterson, Angela Constance, Ken Macintosh, Bill Kidd, Robin Harper, Maureen Watt, Jackie Baillie, Jack McConnell*
S3M-3499 Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 23 February 2009) Christine Grahame*
S3M-3499 Launch of the Fairtrade Fortnight (lodged on 23 February 2009) Anne McLaughlin*
